post_text: The Child Nutrition program would like to announce the USDA has extended the SSO program to December 31, 2020. The extension of the SSO Program will allow schools to serve meals to ALL students at NO COST, regardless of income status or free and reduced lunch qualifications. If you are interested in picking up a meal for your virtual student or younger children, please contact our office at 405-756-3131 or Melissa Randol at mrandol@lindsay.k12.ok.us to sign up for the meals. We will need the following information: Name and number of children needing a meal. (Please do not leave a voicemail). Thank you

Lindsay Schools will be hosting our 2020 Graduation Ceremony on Saturday, July 11th at 10:00a.m. The event will be held at Burford Field on the south end of the campus. Everyone is invited to attend. Approximately 200 chairs will be available and patrons are invited to bring lawn chairs. The ceremony will also be streamed live on the school Facebook page.
The senior video will be shown at 10:00 a.m. on Friday, July 10th in the school auditorium.

However, we realize that this may not meet the needs of some of our students, so we are analyzing software packages to help us with virtual education.

Sincerely,
Dan Chapman

On Monday, June 29th we had one of our student athletes test positive for Covid 19. The parents of the student were very up front and wanted to do everything possible to make sure our other students were not exposed. The student will self-quarantine for the next 14 days.
After consulting with medical professionals we have decided to close all of our facilities until July 6th. We plan to continue our cleaning routines and the spray misting of our facilities to eliminate viruses. This will also allow time for Covid testing of our students if the parent/guardian chooses this route.
The health and safety of our students is still and always will be our top priority. If you have further concerns give me a call at 405-756-3131.
Sincerely,
Dan Chapman

Directions for use:
Go to the school website at www.lindsay.k12.ok.us or to www.wengage.com/lindsay and log into your account.

If you need further assistance, please contact me at 405-428-3039 or by email at rchapman@lindsay.k12.ok.us.
Thank you,
Robin Chapman, Child Nutrition Director

post_text: Yesterday, a teacher notified our administration about a threat against the school that someone had written in a textbook. We have contacted law enforcement, they are investigating the matter, and we will increase our vigilance to ensure staff and student safety within our buildings. Because of the times in which we live, we take every threat as truth and will act swiftly and accordingly. We will not tolerate any behavior that threatens our student body or our staff. We ask that families emphasize to your children the importance of immediately telling an adult if they ever hear or read something that could potentially lead to others’ harm. Likewise, we must also stress to our children the consequences (both short- and long-term) that they could face if they are found to have made such a threat. Please feel free to contact Superintendent Chapman’s office if you have any questions or concerns about this incident.

JOINT STATEMENT ON SCHOOL SAFETY

The safety of our students is of the utmost importance to Lindsay Public School. We strive to protect our students on a daily basis.

Our district has spent considerable time and effort planning and practicing safety and security measures appropriate for dealing with major critical incidents. Along with the Lindsay Police Department we conduct regular safety procedures and drills. The Lindsay Police Department helps plan and carry out these procedures. These procedures ensure students, teachers and staff know how to best respond if the unthinkable occurs.
Student safety is always a top priority. The public can help keep schools safe by reporting any suspicious or unusual activity to law enforcement. Anyone with information should call the Lindsay Police Department at 405-756-4481 or to remain anonymous call Crime Stoppers at 405.366.7867.
